hops.name: Magnum
hops.notes: Very clean bittering hop, leaves almost no flavour used early in the boil. This is very handy for hop heavy beers with much use of late and dry hops

mashFermentables.notes: Variety: Laureate. Colour (EBC 5.4) Usage >100% of grain bill.
mashFermentables.name: Pop's Pale Ale
Flaked Barley
mashFermentables.usedIn: Up to 10 of grist, good in stouts.

mashFermentables.name: Munich Malt I
mashFermentables.notes:
Used in Dark Lagers, Dark Beer, Bock Beer, October Beer, Stout, “Schwarzbier”, Brown Ale, Dark Ale and Amber Beer amongst others, at a rate of up to 100%
It has the effect of enhancing  dark beer body and aroma.

mashFermentables.name: Wheat, Torrified
mashFermentables.notes: Unmalted wheat torrified for use in a single step infusion. Typically used for Wits and other wheats where raw unmalted wheat is called for.
Provides a smoothness to Porters and other dark beers
mashFermentables.name: Brown Malt
CaraAmber
mashFermentables.notes:
For use in Bock Beer, Dunkel Ale, Brown Ale, Red Lager, Amber Ale and Amber Lager amongst many others.
Use at a rate of up to 20%
Produces improved flavone stability, promoted fullness, enhanced colour, full red colour and better mash results.

Adjunct for bitters, milds and stouts 3% – 5% of grist.
Main Characteristics – Strong coffee Flavour.
mashFermentables.name: Chocolate Malt

notes:
Target: ABV = 5.87 %, IBU = 38.3, EBC = 86.5, OG = 1.057, FG = 1.012.

Single step Infusion rising from 50°C to 66°C for 90 Minutes.
Fermented at 28°C with CML Hornindal Kveik

yeasts.name: Hornindal Kveik
yeasts.description: A wonderfully unique Norwegian farmstead kveik, Hornindal produces a tropical flavor and complex aroma that can present itself as stonefruit, pineapple, and dried fruit leather, which complement fruit-forward hops. Add even more dimension to “C” hops and increase ester intensity with a high fermentation temperature. Ferments well at 90° F/32° C or higher. Non-phenolic and no fusels, even at higher temps.
